snippet: William Campbell of Drew University, Satoshi Omura of Kitasato University and Youyou Tu of the China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences won the award.

byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Beijing, and Jonathan Soble from Tokyo.

abstract: Scientists William C Campbell, Satoshi Omura and Tu Youyou are jointly awarded Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their work on treatment of parasitic diseases; Drs Campbell and Omura, who share one-half of $960,000 award, collaborated on remedy for onchocerciasis, or river blindness, while Dr Tu, who won other half, drew on Chinese medicine to develop drug to combat malaria.
lead_paragraph: William Campbell of Drew University, Satoshi Omura of Kitasato University and Youyou Tu of the China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences won the award.

headline.print_headline: 3 Share Nobel for Work on Treatment of ‘Devastating’ Parasitic Diseases
headline.main: Nobel Prize in Medicine Awarded to 3 Scientists for Parasite-Fighting Therapies
